active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the most critical OWASP Top 10 risk for modern web applications incorporating LLMs (e.g., injection vs. prompt injection). Support your position with evidence from OWASP resources and real-world breach examples, then vote on the group's consensus top risk.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in OWASP Training Resources (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Software Development Security > Software Development Ecosystems > 001_Developer Security Culture and Training > Security Training Programs > OWASP Training Resources). Use university pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy across objectives, active learning scaffolding in 4 layers, voter consensus (82.9% approval on completeness/pedagogy). Core Content: OWASP (non-profit for software security). Key projects: Top 10 (web risks), ASVS (L1-L3 verification), LLM Top 10 (AI risks), Secure Coding Practices (input validation, session mgmt, crypto, error handling, DB security, full checklist). Best practices: Expand to access control, etc. Big picture: Fosters DevSecOps culture. Related: SDLC, SAMM, cheat sheets. Prior knowledge: Basic web dev/SQL. Learning Objectives: [Insert the 6 objectives from above]. Scaffolding: [Insert full scaffolding layers]. Active Learning: Inspire cards from activities (e.g., code analysis). Generate 50 high-quality flashcards (mix: 20% Layer1 Recall, 30% Layer2 Understand/Analyze, 30% Layer3 Apply, 20% Layer4 Evaluate/Create). Varied types per schema. Ensure spaced repetition: Atomic facts, active recall. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards: [{'id':1, 'front':'...', 'back':'...', 'bloom_level':'...', 'layer':1, 'tags':['Top10']}, ...]. Follow schema strictly: Distractors plausible/web-grounded, explanations comprehensive with OWASP refs.
